item.title: Heidi add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There are few people whom I really love, and still fewer of whom I think well. The more I see of the world, the more am I dissatisfied with it; and every day confirms my belief of the inconsistency of all human characters, and of the little dependence that can be placed on the appearance of merit or sense." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love. I require so much!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Philippa Gregory
item.description: "For Harry Potter I have all the time in the world." -- Philippa Gregory

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Philippa Gregory
item.description: "The world hasn't changed that much; men still rule." -- Philippa Gregory

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "Remember to always be yourself. Unless you suck." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "Two roads diverged in a wood, and I took the road less traveled by and they CANCELLED MY FRIKKIN' SHOW. I totally shoulda took the road that had all those people on it. Damn." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "I write to give myself strength. I write to be the characters that I am not. I write to explore all the things I'm afraid of. " -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "I'll take crazy over stupid any day." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "Every day's a negotiation and sometimes it's done with guns." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Mutant Enemy/Joss Whedon
item.description: "Half of writing history is hiding the truth." -- Mutant Enemy/Joss Whedon

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "Humor keeps us alive. Humor and food. Don't forget food. You can go a week without laughing." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "You're going to burn in a very special level of hell. A level they reserve for child molesters and people who talk at the theater." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Charlaine Harris
item.description: "But there's a juicy artery in your groin," he said after a pause to regroup, his voice as slithery as a snake on a slide. "Don't you talk dirty," I told him. "I won't listen to that." -- Charlaine Harris

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Charlaine Harris
item.description: "Here’s to books, the cheapest vacation you can buy." -- Charlaine Harris

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Charlaine Harris
item.description: "Eric moved the broom experimentally and made an attempt to sweep the glass into the pan while it lay in the middle of the floor. Of course, the pan slid away. Eric scowled. I'd finally found something Eric did poorly." -- Charlaine Harris

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Gerard Way
item.description: "Hey, girls, you're beautiful. Don't look at those stupid magazines with sticklike models. Eat healthy and exercise. That's all. Don't let anyone tell you you're not good enough. You're good enough, you are too good. Love your family with all your heart and listen to it. You are gorgeous, whether you're a size 4 or 14. It doesn't matter what you look like on the outside, as long as you're a good person, as long as you respect others. I know it's been told hundreds of times before, but it's true. Hey, girls, you are beautiful." -- Gerard Way

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "When you have eliminated all which is impossible, then whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "It doesn't matter what people tell you. It doesn't matter what they might say. Sometimes you have to leave home. Sometimes, running away means you're headed in the exact right direction." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "Holding a tear back makes them drain upward, higher and higher, until one day your head just explodes and you're left with a stub of a neck and nothing more." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Phillipa Gregory
item.description: "You have to choose the best, every day, without compromise...guided by your own virtue and highest ambition" -- Phillipa Gregory

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Philippa Gregory
item.description:
"Good Christian people, I am come hither to die, for according to the law, and by the law I am judged to die, and therefore I will speak nothing against it. I am come hither to accuse no man, nor to speak anything of that, whereof I am accused and condemned to die, but I pray God save the king and send him long to reign over you, for a gentler nor a more merciful prince was there never: and to me he was ever a good, a gentle and sovereign lord. And if any person will meddle of my cause, I require them to judge the best. And thus I take my leave of the world and of you all, and I heartily desire you all to pray for me. O Lord have mercy on me, to God I commend my soul.'
After being blindfolded and kneeling at the block, she repeated several times: To Jesus Christ I commend my soul; Lord Jesu receive my soul." -- Philippa Gregory

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Wil Wheaton
item.description: "Sometimes we know in our bones what we really need to do, but we're afraid to do it. Taking a chance and stepping beyond the safety of the world we've always known is the only way to grow, though and without risk there is no reward." -- Wil Wheaton

item.title: Heidi add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "Winter is coming." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Heidi add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "Night gathers, and now my watch begins. It shall not end until my death. I shall take no wife, hold no lands, father no children. I shall wear no crowns and win no glory. I shall live and die at my post. I am the sword in the darkness. I am the watcher on the walls. I am the fire that burns against cold, the light that brings the dawn, the horn that wakes the sleepers, the shield that guards the realms of men. I pledge my life and honor to the Night's Watch, for this night and all the nights to come." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Heidi add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "Fear cuts deeper than swords." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Heidi add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "Never forget what you are, for surely the world will not. Make it your strength. Then it can never be your weakness. Armour yourself in it, and it will never be used to hurt you." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Alison Weir
item.description: "I prefer to be left alone with my books." -- Alison Weir

item.title: Heidi add a quote by Simon Pegg
item.description: "Being a geek is all about being honest about what you enjoy and not being afraid to demonstrate that affection. It means never having to play it cool about how much you like something. It’s basically a license to proudly emote on a somewhat childish level rather than behave like a supposed adult. Being a geek is extremely liberating." -- Simon Pegg
